New Records: West Indies completed a 3-2 series victory over England
Jason Holder became the fourth player to take four wickets in four balls in a T20I match
Key Match Events: High-pressure final over where Holder took four quick wickets
Pre-Game Insights: Moeen Ali highlighted West Indies' batting depth as'scary'
Kieron Pollard chose to bat first considering the pitch conditions
Post-Match Reflections: Jason Holder was named Player of the Match
England's defeat exposed areas needing attention, particularly death bowling
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on the same pitch where Rovman Powell had previously run riot
The series was a decider, following a low-scoring opener and challenging pitch conditions under lights
